channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: AI is becoming the ‘magic fix’ as America places ‘one big bet’ on it not being a bubble, market veteran warns
item.description: "AI better deliver for the US, or its economy and markets will lose the one leg they are now standing on," warns Ruchir Sharma of Rockefeller Internat...

item.title: Greta Thunberg Among Hundreds From Gaza Aid Flotilla Deported by Israel
item.description: Israel intercepted the boats at sea and detained the participants for days before expelling them. Some of the activists say they were mistreated, whic...

item.title: Who is Judge Immergut? Trump Appointee in Oregon Blocks Troop Deployment.
item.description: Judge Karin Immergut worked on Ken Starr’s investigation of Bill Clinton. Now she’s ruled against Trump’s attempt to send troops to Portland.

item.title: An ‘IRS CEO’ now exists, and Social Security Administrator Frank Bisignano is the first to fill the position
item.description: Bisignano will report to Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent, who currently serves as acting commissioner of the IRS.

item.title: C.I.A. Deputy Director Has Replaced Agency’s Top Legal Official With Himself
item.description: It is not clear what is behind the move by Michael Ellis, a Trump loyalist. A legal ethics specialist said it could raise conflict-of-interest issues.

item.title: Elon Musk Gambles on Sexy A.I. Companions
item.description: In July, the billionaire’s A.I. company introduced two sexually explicit chatbots, pushing a new version of intimacy.

item.title: Tan Su Shan, CEO of Southeast Asia’s largest bank, is Fortune’s most powerful woman in Asia for 2025
item.description: DBS's new CEO is No. 1 on Fortune's second-ever Most Powerful Women Asia ranking, among a finance- and tech-heavy top five.

item.title: Gold drives toward $4,000 as U.S. government shutdown drags on
item.description: The precious metal rallied as much as 2.2% to top $3,970 an ounce in the week’s opening session.

item.title: Trump’s message to ‘the young people of TikTok’ and Gen Z: ‘You owe me big’
item.description: Trump endorsed the idea of a TikTok ban all the way back in 2020.

item.title: Trump Aimed Shutdown Cuts at Democrats, but G.O.P. Districts Are Hit, Too
item.description: As the president cancels projects in Democratic-run states, he is cutting money that benefits his own party’s lawmakers in some of the most competitiv...

item.title: Israel at War With Itself
item.description: On the second anniversary of the Oct. 7 attacks, Roger Cohen explains how the war in Gaza has left Israel divided and isolated.

item.title: What to Know as Gisèle Pelicot Returns to Court for Man’s Appeal
item.description: The Frenchwoman who became a feminist icon came to confront one of the men convicted after her husband drugged her and invited them to rape her over n...

item.title: Syria Chooses a Parliament of Revolutionaries
item.description: In the first elections since the Assad regime was ousted, there was no popular vote and women and minorities won few seats. Still, many Syrians saw it...

item.title: Marine Park in Ontario Warns It May Euthanize Beluga Whales Without Cash Infusion
item.description: The government has barred Marineland from shipping its whales to an aquarium in China so the park is threatening to put the whales down.

item.title: Greta Thunberg Among Hundreds From Gaza Aid Flotilla Deported by Israel
item.description: Israel intercepted the boats at sea and detained the participants for days before expelling them. Some of the activists say they were mistreated, whic...
